Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but a lot of niggles”
Reviews.Author: CurrySpice
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and, in general, really liked the hotel. Lovely view from the room (after complaning about the first room we were given). Large room and nice bathroom. The hotel is in the town of Kadikoy which is really lively with lots of restaurants and bars. We had some really great Turkish food and enjoyed the atmosphere. However, for an upmarket hotel, there were too many small snags for our liking: - tv constantly switching itself off - housekeeping knocking really early- 8am on a Sunday?!?! - the roof top pool was closed. No mention of this on the site before we booked - the hottest gym I have ever been in!!! - unable to use the indoor pool because we did not have bathing caps - don't take a room on the top three floors. There's a really noisy club up there which will keep you awake till the early hours It's a good hotel and the location is great. The ferry ride to Istanbul is a highlight of the experience. Just need to iron out the creases the it would be really fabulous

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Greenie44
Reviews.Content: A good business hotel less than a quarter mile from the Kadikoy ferry stop - and 5 minutes from the fantastic Ciya restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: NorfolkMum
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are excellent very helpful and offer a very high standard of service. The room was large,clean and very comfortable with a lovely view over the sea of marmara and Haydarpasa railway station. The hotel is also in a great location for the ferries to the European side of Istanbul with all the things that Istanbul is famous for only a 15 min ferry crossing away.3mins from the hotel is a Starbucks coffee shop, a supermarket selling everything you might need, There are lots of place to eat and drink all within a 5min walk as well as the main shopping area 10mins away all with prices much cheaper than the European side of Istanbul.For people who enjoy a walk the seaside area has a lovely walking path with an outside gym just 5mins away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel with excellent location on the asian side of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: west_coast_of_europe
Reviews.Content: I've stayed several times on Doubletree Moda during 2011/2, good location on the asian side of Istanbul but with several boat connections to other locations on the european side. Modern hotel (around 3 years I guess) with good facilities (excellent SAP and fitness centre), the sea views are outstanding. Very good reception service always welcoming you with a smile and great service. The standard rooms have the basic you would expect on a 5* hotel but depending of the floor and on your neighbours it can be quite noisy since you can easily listen what's happening on the other room, if you can get the sea side rooms! Nearby there is a great offer of good restaurants, but if you prefer to stay at the hotel go for room service, it is not cheap, but you have more choice, better service when you compare it with the ground floor restaurant. I made a couple of meals there and I can assure you don't get what you paid for, the food is not great, the service is average and it costs more than room service. On top floor you can find during spring/summer time a great swimming pool which gets converted to a bar during the night, the view is just outstanding! On the same floor there's also another restaurant which doesn't belong to the hotel, it is a local fancy/posh restaurant with a great view but quite expensive, typically full from Thursday to Sunday nights. Had dinner there once, for sushi, and it was a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad hotel but not worth for price.”
Reviews.Author: Kivanc B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend only a week ago and i can't say we were too impressed. After not being able to find somewhere to stay on saturday night on BÃ¼yÃ¼kada, we decided to come here. The girl that i talked on phone about reservation was only nice till i say i won't reserve suit or deluxe/corner room. After asking "how much are standard rooms?", i felt that i was an ordinary person in her eyes. She was not willing to give so much information and she was still trying to give me the price of corner room which is 199 euro + taxes. So we booked a standard room with land view which is 99 euro + tax ( 254 lira ) and not even a bottle of water is included in this price. Neither breakfast as you can guess. So for breakfast we had to pay 60 more so it came to 310 lira. And while you are paying, they get extra money from you as a "deposit" that "if" you use the minibar. And the extra money they get is just up to them, she settled it as 90 lira and we gave 400 lira. After paying 400 lira at 5 pm to stay one night doesn't make you feel so comfortable. And they don't give you any paper about your extra payment! I wasn't feeling secure about that. And while we were leaving she said to me wrongly "It looks like you paid 400 lira less, can i please take it?". My girlfriend says my expression in my face was really exhausted. Then they paid us back 85 lira after we discussed about it. Rooms are really small though for not little amount of money. Minibar is of course very unnecessarily expensive. If you want to watch any movies, which are not new surely, you have to pay and stuff. And obviously they "somehow" got permission to put that ugly building in middle of Moda which looks "terrible" from the sea. Come on, where's the aesthetic or respect to silhouette? Rooms don't even have any balcony and windows can only be opened like 5 cm (less than size of hand) And one of the most disappointing thing was breakfast for us. With my girlfriend, we always and always look forward to have good breakfast buffet and we've been told that it's awesome breakfast with more than 100 kinds of food. I think what they mean was more than 100 kinds of bread. Only 2 good things about breakfast, things were mostly fresh and they were giving you juice when you sit to table. And since this is a big building, breakfast area is really really small. In a hotel with only 13 rooms on BÃ¼yÃ¼kada had bigger area with great sea view and way better bÃ¶reks! :) And the girl that i talked on phone first (which i wrote that i didn't like) were trying to sell me the breakfast as well in the beginning by saying that "if you want it now it's only 30 euro, but if you don't buy it now and do it later, it's 50 euro! ) Allah Allah yaa! :) And when we wanted to change our room and go to one which you are allowed to smoke, they sent us ashtray instead! Well to sum it, i can say it really is not worthy for this money. Nothing definitely special about this hotel apart from unnecessary luxury. To not feel guilty, i will point few good things about hotel as well: After we checked in, the guy who led us to the room, Zekeriya, was really really really nice guy. Also while we were leaving hotel in the morning with our Galatasaray jerseys for Galatasaray's match in European side, he told us we can leave the luggages and get it after if we want. He was so kind. But we normally live in European side anyways so we didn't need to that. And cookie they give you entrance is great. View and location is good of course but since i remember this hotel is ruining the view itself!, it doesn't attract me at all. Careline etc. staff on phone was helpful. I told them i think our remote's battery is out, they were directly sending someone but till someone came my girlfriend exchanged batteries places and it worked (it always works you know:)) The bed was soft and comfortable. I've written long i think, thanks for reading. I would advise you to spend your money on some other hotel with better service and lovelier staff(most of staff were not so nice), and not waste it for hilton name. Oh i forgot something. You should really check and how funny prices are about the special tours which you can find in books in your room if you go. It was really, really funny and expensive. For instance, "DolmabahÃ§e Palace tour, 1010 Euro! (thousand wouldn't be enough for sure)", "going to traditional Turkish barber shop, only few hundred euros!" etc. Have a good trip!

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree, Double worth”
Reviews.Author: inetbas
Reviews.Content: Doubletree Moda is currently my default stay for a long business engagement. I've abandoned the Hilton chain for a long long time (so much bad experiences). But the Doubletree Moda and it staff turned that around for me. Nice modern Hotel, good situated for doing business in the Asia part of Istanbul. At the same time it is easy to get across to the Old city center or even Airport. Great staff. Decent restaurant, nice rooms and facilities. So a recommendation to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice modern hotel with fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: Shuttie
Reviews.Content: Superb location, for ferrys to the old town, and I recommend the fast ferry from/to the airtport. Views are fantastic over the Bosphorus and over to the Old Town. Only downside is that the traffic can bea bit chaotic, due to some road layout works going on in the area, and general trafiic congestion you expect in Istanbul. Hotel staff were very friendly from the reception staff to the waiters. Rooms are clean (obviously new... I guess the hotel is less than 12 months old) and well equipped, with tea/coffee making facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Bad About This Hotel, Magnificent Service with Perfect View”
Reviews.Author: okocakaya
Reviews.Content: I had the chance to stay at Double Tree by Hilton - Moda on 28th of January and to be honest, it was one of the best experiences for accomodation. The welcoming of the staff was perfect, the hotel was very clean and comfy. This is a 5star hotel with an amazing sea view so my expectations was high and honestly all my expectations were satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “5 star facility, but some hiccups - if you read this you will know”
Reviews.Author: newyorker88
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here for 3 days, as well as the Doubletree Old Town, I can give you a true review. First, the good points: 1) The room are fantastic. Large, well appointed. You will not be disappointed with them except see below. 2) The staff are great. 3) Kadikoy is a read Turkish town and you will get a great feeling from it and there are some great restaurants there. 4) The hotel has some very nice facilities, but also see below. If you are relatively young and active, you will enjoy this hotel. The Ferry ride is fast, efficient and a pleasure. If you are pressed for time in Istanbul, then you will need every minute and perhaps you might want to stay in Old Town or Eminenu. Now, the few issues - First, stepping into the bathtub is really high, so if you are elderly or have mobility problems, you might have problems getting into the bathtub/shower. Second, the bathrub/shower has a curtain/shade that does up and down so if you want to see the Bospherus from the bathtub, you can. However, if someone goes to the bathroom in the middle of the night and turns on the light, it will seriously light up the room. Last, if you are planing to swim, you must bring your own bathing cap, or you will have to buy one for about USD 13...this is a bummer if you don't bring one. The pool is nice, but there were working on it when we were visiting and my kids were really upset. So, bottom line is that the hotel facility and staff are fabulous. But, there are a few things you should know about where it is located, the bathtub and room. BTW, the breakfast is pretty good as well. If you are deciding on between the Doubletree Old Town and Moda, they are both nice hotels and better than any Hilton in the U.S. If you want to be right in the middle of the tourist area and need convenience, then you should go with the Old Town. if you want to be away from the tourist area and have some to spare, then stay at Moda. We broke it us and enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your step !!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: COYDRCOY
Reviews.Content: just 400 m to asian centre of istanbul,boats to old city and also to europe, view of marmara sea and topkapÄ± palace from the sea-side rooms,smoking oppurtunity and tea/coffee set in your room, too long water seperator for the bathtube as no flat place for your foot while stepping in and had an accident as I skipped,no answer back from the hotel during the 8 months since I wrote down about my accident and even draw a stech of the seperator and advised how to solve the problem,so take care of your step......

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, with a few minor issues”
Reviews.Author: mirza777
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Doubletree Istanbul - Moda for 4 nights during our week long trip to Turkey. Overall, we were very happy with the service, location, staff, cleanliness and comfort. Below, are some specific points with respect to our experience. Arrival: We arrived at 8:00 am on the morning of our check-in. Although check-in time is not until Noon, the hotel staff made all efforts to accommodate our early arrival and we were able to get a room before 10:00 am, which allowed us to freshen up before making our way over to the city for a day of sightseeing. Our Greeter Karem was extremely helpful upon arrival and made arrangements for us to have complimentary tea/coffee and wifi while we waited for our room to be ready. The room: We had booked the King room with deluxe view for our first 3 night stay and the king room for our last night at the hotel. The deluxe view room was certainly bigger, but we still found it to be a tight fit with our 4 pieces of luggage. Since the hotel was only 4 months old at the time of our visit, the rooms were in great shape. Our room had an excellent view of the old city, day or night. The only issue we had with this room is that on our second day we noted an odd smell coming from the bathroom, somewhat like mold or mildew (possibly from a water leak). After asking the front desk staff to investigate, they offered us another deluxe view room, but this time with a view of the Bosphorus only and not the old city. On the third day we were moved back to a room with full view of the old city, as promised by the Hotel Manager. Although, anyone would consider it a hassle to switch between 3 rooms in 3 nights, the attention given to us by the hotel staff and particularly the Manager to address the issue made up for it. Breakfast: The breakfast was great, with tons of fresh fruits, veggies, olives, pickles, meat, breads, muffins, pastries, cereal and coffee/tea/juice. The kitchen offered fresh eggs & waffles made to order. We had booked our room via expedia and booked the room & breakfast package. However, we were presented with a bill for breakfast 3 out of the 4 mornings we had breakfast at the hotel. I guess most guests do not have breakfast included with their stay and therefore the wait staff would present each guest with a bill by default. The issue was addressed each time by explaining to the wait staff, who then confirmed with the front desk that our breakfast was included. Hotel Location: The hotel is located in the Kadikoy area of Istanbul on the Asian side. At first we were concerned whether this would be a good location given the purpose of our trip was to see historical Istanbul, which is mostly on the European side. Access to the European side was quite convenient, as the hotel is less then a 10 minute walk from the Kadikoy ferry dock with ferries to Eminnou (European side) departing every 15 mins and the trip was about 20 mins. The one-way fare per person was 1.4TL and the fare tokens were easy to obtain from machines located at the ferry docks. There is also a fast ferry that departs Kadikoy for Bakirkoy via Yenikapi. Bakikoy is a 10 min drive from Ataturk international airport and there are taxis and buses available upon disembarking from the ferry, which offers a much cheaper alternative to a taxi when travelling from Kadikoy to Ataturk Airport (given you're not pulling around a lot of luggage!). We tried the fast ferry when travelling to and from the airport for a 3-day trip to the Izmir region and found it to be punctual, comfortable and very reasonably priced. Although Kadikoy is not the touristy part of Istanbul and it might be difficult to communicate with the local population (unless you speak Turkish!), we were able to get by without any problems. We ate out every night, trying something different each time. The local food joints were very reasonably priced (compared to the European side) and offered the authentic Turkish cuisine we were craving. Airport Transfer: As mentioned above, there is the option of taking the fast ferry from Ataturk Airport. However, if you've got more then 1 piece of luggage per person, a taxi might be the better option. We took a cab on our way to the hotel early on a Sunday morning and the cost was about 60 TL. However, the trip to the airport was much longer and cost about 100TL. Upon questioning the driver, he explained that he took the longer route to avoid traffic, but we're not sure if that was really the case. However, it is always best to agree on a fare before hand if possible. Also, if using the fast ferry from Kadikoy to Bakirkoy, keep in mind that he taxis running from Bakirkoy to the airport will likely take multiple fares (4 passengers) to the airport and it's advisable to clarify the fare per passenger. Hotel staff: We found the staff to be very helpful and attentive and most if not all were able to communicate in English. The Hotel Manager was very helpful in telling us about the fast ferry to the airport and even assisted us with online check-in for our domestic flight to Izmir and called Turkish Airlines on our behalf to try to upgrade our booking back to Toronto. We were also able to leave some of our luggage in the hotel's secure storage while we travelled to the Izmir area for a few days (given we were coming back to the hotel for 1 night before departing Turkey). Overall: We were very happy with our stay at the Hilton Doubletree Istanbul - Moda. It is an excellent new addition to Istanbul, and for any future trips to Istanbul, we will definitely consider this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Poor Location, Great View, Smelling Rooms”
Reviews.Author: matakan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this Hotel for 3 nights at corner king room with sea view at 9th floor. The location of the hotel a little bit isolated area from the most common areas. The hotel is at the Anatolian provience of the Istanbul. The most famous area of this part of the town is Bagdat Avenue. The hotel is really isolated from that kind of area. At the around of the hotel you can find old historical streets and local reastaurants but area is a little bit low budget. Hotel is very closer to the Kadikoy Pier and Kadikoy Haydarpasa Train Station. The room prices are very good. Breakfast is rich and tasty. There is a heliport facility just next of the hotel, so you can arrange heli transfer from next of the hotel. Its not a good idea for tourist in my mind. If you dont have business around, i m not advicing this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay & great location”
Reviews.Author: arsemia
Reviews.Content: First of all Doubletree by Hilton- Moda is a great hotel. I would definitely recommend the hotel for everyone. The location is perfect. Only a short walk (about 5-10 minutes) to the Kadikoy ferry station and the bus stops. Using the ferry, it is very convenient to explore the old town (Eminonu, Sultanahmet area), plus there is the lovely trip across the sea. I would definitely recommend the Hotel, compared to the old and small ones in the downtown area. Because, you can get much more for your money by staying a little away from the old town and Taksim. The hotel is new. The building, rooms and the view are perfect. We've been upgraded to a deluxe room, thanks to the Hotel management, and the view is just stunning. Bathroom amenities are â€œNeutrogenaâ€� branded. There are kettle, instant coffee and tea in the room. Breakfast is also very good. However, I have seen better ones in other Hiltons in Turkey (especially HiltonSA in Ankara). One drawback is the unavailability of hot coffee during the breakfast. I insisted on a â€œhot oneâ€� every time but always ended up with a medium warm coffee every time. In conclusion, I would definitely recommend this hotel, for business, tourism, etc. in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: swedishtravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights during our holiday in Istanbul. We really enjoyed it. The hotel is located on the Asian side of town and the area feels authentic and local. The are lots of small restaurants, bars and shops in the area, and not so much tourists. If you want to go to the other side of town to see the sights and so on, you can take a boat from the nearby boat station. This is not just transport, itÂ´s very nice to take the boat, Ã­tÂ´s like sightseeing, you see a lot from the boat. You can also take a dolmus, a minibus, like a shared taxi. They also go from the boat station to the Taksim square and itÂ´s very cheap. The hotel is very nice and modern. Clean and nice. The spa area inside with pool and sauna is nice and if itÂ´s warm outside the rooftop pool is nice but a bit windy. I really recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but with few drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: andreunz
Reviews.Content: LOCATION The hotel is located in a quieter area than the busy centre, therefore giving us some more time to rest. In order to get there, we had to take the boat; this means being about 1 hour from the central locations. There is a nice view of works in progress from the window, but also of the sea. On top of the hotel there is a cute, small swimming pool. SERVICE: Reception and doormen Receptionists are ok and very friendly. They would take care of our requiremenents. However attention must be paid to the doormen. Upon arrival, they would stick to you and remove your luggage from your hands (which is something I personally dislike, as I am fit and can stroll my own luggage). During check-in the reception would provide few answers about the hotel in general and would tell you that the doorman, on your way to your room, would tell you more about the hotel â€“ easy to understand this is done for the tips business However we were quite badly impressed from the doormen behaviour on another occasion We had been previously told by some local friends that the fare from this Hilton to the Sabiah Airport by taxi should not exceed 55 Turkish liras. Therefore before leaving, we asked the taxi driver parked outside if he would have been happy with 25Euros (63 Turkish liras) Once received our luggage, however, the doorman went with it to the taxi driver, even before we had put together all our stuff. Once we were sat in the taxi he said we had to pay 30Euros (75 liras). To my great disappointment, we asked the reason and he said that the driver did not speak English and he had misunderstood. We were already inside, so we decided not to complain- but I do regret the tip I had given the doormen, who obviously has his own agreement with the drivers. Once at destination the cost of the taxi was 61liras (and we still paid 30 Euros!!) HOUSE KEEPING SERVICE The weakest point of this hotel. In our fridge we found leftovers from the previous guests. There was hair in the toilet and the towels were folded like in a 2 stars hotel. Saturday night there was a party on the bar on top, which made it difficult to sleep and most the items from the mini-bar had already expired. We never received any turndown service on none of the 3 days of our staying. We feedbacked this to the manager, who was very nice and attentive to our points, but still nothing was done to the room itself (writing paper still missing) Overall a good hotel, but with disconnected department that give the guest a mixed feeling between a three stars and a five stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very nice and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dilmoson
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at this Hotel 2 times in this year and both was such a pleasure. I have stayed at the other hilton properties in Istanbul but this one was the newewst , most modern and best one for me. very close to almost ferry-port and bus stations, ( only 150 m away) that makes the place very easy to reach everywhere. no need to worry about the traffic jam. Breakfast is a bit poor but may be this is normal for doubletree properties.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the entire trip to tourkey including hotel double tree hilton moda”
Reviews.Author: tiger40mumbai
Reviews.Content: During Eid holidays we planned a visit to Turkey and booked at Doubletree by Hilton Moda at Istanbul. Regarding the Hotel: The Hotel Rooms are very neat ,( alothough small). You can have good see view. However you need to be assertive in asking for Housekeeping facilities. The Hotel is located in the Asian Side of Istanbul and well connected with the entire city. The best part about location is after a long day visiting all tourist attractions, when you proceed towards hotel in the evening... is like going back to home. Double tree well connected and close to KADIKOY Ferry station( you can go to any place in instanbul from this Kadikoy Ferry station ) Most of the site seeing attractions can be visited from Kadikoy which is just 5 minutes walking distance from the Hotel. This hotel is well connected from the Airport also if one follows the directions given at Airport meticulously and follow the Metro train /Tram/Ferry joy rides to reach the Doubletree. The Swimming pool on the Terrace is the best attaraction. You can have a complete view of the city and very beautiful view of the sea. You can spend hours at this pool every day. The breakfast at the hotel is good. The staff are pleasant except one of the front office manager. For Vegetarians, you have limited choice, however the F& B Manger tried his best to make some vegetarian pasta and best part is the concern he showed for the guests needs.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best but good!”
Reviews.Author: AdrianRoata
Reviews.Content: Just come back! At arrival very frendly staff , i came 6 hours earlyer and they give me and my family a room to stay with no extra charge( excellent )!!! But they didn' t knew to give informations about the area and how to get to "old town"( not so good) Near the hotel is a port and u have to find the station KADIKOY to get to Galata Bridge and there u can find Agia Sofia ,Grand Bazar ,Spice Bazar, and anything u want to see in Istanbull (2 lira one way about 20 min over Bosphorus) this batobus is perfect!!!! If u want to go by Dolmus ( buscab) to Taksim market is 5 lira/ pers and u can take it from the port area also! Be verry careful at galata bridge restautant's very expensive and they also cheat u a lot an after that they say to pay the bill cause they don't speak english. DON'T EAT THERE!!!! About the hotel ; - average 5* hotel with a so so breakfast too expensive room ! - the pool area at the top floor TERRIBILE very cold whater( i think they are maiking it colder so the guests don' stay at this pool) !! - indoor pool BAD to very very veryVERY much chlor forbiden for kids - the pools are a VERY BIG MINUS because we choose this hotel for the pools( 2 familly ,2childrens) - services are ok , the restaurant's manager ask u if eferything is ok . - the hotel has a Security Ceck In because they have a lot of arabbish people in ( but very civilased people)! - normal lux hotel with nothing in particular , if u'll go there it will be ok if not u didn't loose anything. - i will not recomand this hotel because they cheat you whit the POOLS THE WORST POOL I HAVE EVER MET AT A 5 star hotel!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not really for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: steve p
Reviews.Content: Room was small and clean with a great view of the Bosphorus. Reception staff were nice and polite - room service - quick -food was ok. No shop in the Hotel -only a souvenir shop -so no Magazines or toiletries etc No ATM in the Hotel -Area is fantastic -many bars and cafes - go to Baghdad Street for shopping - Breakfast was dissapointing - no eggs to order and a dissapointng choice of food - too much bread ! This really is a business hotel and not set up for Familys with children or tourists. Pool on the roof is nice -cocktails -expencive - service slow - 25 mins for a martini !

Reviews.Title: “Wowee Zowee...this is one FANTASTIC place!”
Reviews.Author: GlendaleCA
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe how great this place is in virtually EVERY facet! 1) Super attentive and friendly staff! Bellhops, Front Desk, Fitness Center, Restaurants- all fantastic. A special thank you to Bilge @ the Front Desk who was able to ensure every facet of the stay was excellent. He was very helpful with telling me which ferries to take to different destinations as well as times during important trips like to the airport. One suggestion for the staff: I found that the staff's English language acquisition is a bit lower than other hotels I've stayed @ in Istanbul. Since this is an international chain, many people reserving this hotel will use English as the default "international" language and it would be wise for the hotel to invest in their staff's abilities to learn more English. 2) Great Fitness and Pool facilities. They were top notch. To be able to be in a metropolis like Istanbul and have not only one pool but TWO. Wow. And each one is great. The fitness area is superb. One of the best of any hotel I have EVER stayed in- anywhere on the planet! 3) Breakfast- Excellent in the mornings. A super spread and very nice staff as well. Enormous set of choices. The pastries seemed very fresh- like something you might get at one of the great small independent hotels in Istanbul- just with a HUGE selection. Basically it was a breafast fit for a king or queen! 4) 360 upstairs had a great view as well as great staff. The food was oh kay and the drinks were pretty good. 5) Room Service, by the way, is a STEAL! No service charges or hidden fees! There's so much great food in Istanbul, but I got back to the hotel really late and needed something to eat. And the price on the menu is what you get charged! Tell me where else you've ever been where that is the case! 6) Great views- The views from the rooms are pretty darn spectacular. The hotel truly has a prime piece of real estate on the Anatolian side. 7) The rooms- Excellent, modern flair without being either to trendy or too current in a way that will get outdated too quickly. Great bathrooms, beds, modern tv's and tv stands. Everything was top notch. The only problems were: a) sometimes the curtains were hard to close because the tracking didn't seem to always work that well; b) the cooling system in the corner rooms did not reach the bed area very well- so it tended to be much warmer on that side of the room; and c) there is no covering to the glass in the bathrooms in the corner room; therefore, someone in the room could actually see someone sitting on the toilet and that is not a comforting thought! 8) Location- It works out beautifully! Getting from the airport is a cinch. And in some ways may be easier to get to than many other areas in the city on either side. If you take a taxi to the Bakirkoy Ferry, which costs somewhere between 18-22 TL, you only then need to hop on the Ferry to Kadikoy for 7TL. The trip, door to door, is less than an hour easily and it is only a 3-5 minute walk to the hotel. Tops! You bypass all the traffic in Istanbul by doing this as well. You may, as a tourist or business person be thinking you will be out of your way by being on the Anatolian side. Well DON'T FRET! It's very easy to get to the other side. There are so many ferries within a 5 minute walk of the hotel to the other side. It's such an inexpensive and beautiful way to see the city. I've been to Istanbul before and had not used the ferries. It makes for a very relaxing part of the trip. And a very scenic trip! I could go on more, but that is enough! Great place. Looking forward to staying here again next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent area only a short ferry trip to old town”
Reviews.Author: cpourille
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed in Kadidoy at the Double Tree by Hilton mid July and we had a great time. Yes it is a bit of a pain that they close the pool at 6pm and that the tea / coffee are replenished in a random manner but the rest was great. The hotel is only 5 min walk from lots of bars and restaurants with Asian price tags, not the tourist price you pay in Sultanamet or the ones of the hotel! It is also 5 min walk from the Kadikoy ferry port from where you can go to the old / new town in under 30min and to many other parts of istanbul such as Karikoy, Ortakoy etc all nice places to visit / have a meal or drink! Rooms and beds are so comfortable and if you can get a room facing the sea as the view is fab. I would stay there again, great value especially for hotel with swimming pool, great location, nice staff too.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Reviews of This Hotel Are Not Warranted”
Reviews.Author: romadaro
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have spent the last several days of our vacation at this hotel and can't figure out why this property has received such bad reviews. We've had a wonderful experience and simply can't believe the writeups about poor maintenance, service or bugs in the bed at midnight. Since when did bugs learn to tell time? We were given a corner suite with beautiful views of the city and the Bosphorous and our room has been cleaned everyday immaculately. Not only that, but we had dinner in the ground floor restaurant tonight and the food was delicious and the restaurant manager came to our table several times to ask about the food and the service. When we completed our meal we were too full to have dessert or even coffee, but the manager insisted and comped both and sent it to our room an hour after dinner with no obligation to tip the waiter. Of course, we did as we were impressed by the great service. In addition, my wife happened to mention at checkin how much she liked the chocolate chip cookies and that there was something different about these compared to the cookies served at Doubletree's in the States, so they have sent four warm cookies (2 for her and 2 for me) to our room each evening. As they say, it's the little things that count. The hotel is very convenient to the ferries to the European side of the city and the hotel staff bends over backwards to help, although they are as new as the hotel and some don't have control of the English language yet. But, at least they try to be as helpful as they can or will go get someone else if they don't quite understand what you're asking. Bottom line is that my experience here doesn't mesh with the bad reviews that I've been reading. Granted it's a new hotel and it will take a few months to work out some of the kinks. But, maintenance, service and dining aren't a problem here, so don't shy away from booking this property if you're going to Istanbul and looking for a good hotel. I definitely wouldn't hesitate to book this hotel again if coming back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, great stay”
Reviews.Author: hiba26
Reviews.Content: we stayed me & my husband for 5 days at this hotel, the hotel was great new,clean, the staff was very helpful & polite.our room was sea view & that was amazing i couldn't close the curtains, the beds was very comfortable i hardly wake up everyday, the bathroom was very clean & of a good size but the only problem was with the tub is high & not easily to get in.the breakfast was good.the swimming pool was amazing it has a view that will keep you amazed.the location was great the ferry boats is 3 minutes walking from the hotel & only 1.75 Tl for each, the boat ride was beautiful & we arrive faster to the European side than taking a taxi because there is a lot of traffic, the ferry boats rides every 30 minutes & the last one was at 8.45 p.m. the hotel is near Baghdad caddesi wich is 10 to 15 minuted ride this street has a lot of shops & cafes i highly recommend visiting this street, there is also a very close shops & restaurants to the hotel around 5 minutes walking from the hotel, we ate at kofte express it was great.there is a small market in front of the hotel if you want to buy water or snacks.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice, convenient hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mypointofviewis
Reviews.Content: I felt I had to write this review as I cannot agree with the bad reviews. This hotel is new and very handy for the ferries to the European side of the Bosphorus. The staff were very helpful, the room very comfortable. The food was excellent although rather expensive as was the wine (Â£9 per glass). One of the complaints from some friends was about room cleaning staff entering a room without knocking. The area seems to be very safe although the hotel itself has quite a strong security presence.

Reviews.Title: “The good outweighed the bad ...however”
Reviews.Author: Dennisinsandiego
Reviews.Content: I just returned home from staying at this hotel for the past 2 weeks and felt compelled to write a comment. Overall, my stay was very pleasant. the hotel staff went out of their way to assist me in findind directions, changing money, or anything else that I needed. The metal detectors were a bit odd, but I guess that is standard for Istanbul. The room was very clean and comfortable, yet was a bit on the small side. My room faced the area of Kadikoy and not the Sea of Mamara (which was ok). My only real complaint was the bathroom, and in partiular, the shower. In a word it was "dangerous"! The sliding glass door would only partially open, preventing you from entering the shower with any degree of comfort or safety. The tub was too short for the opening of the glass door that you only had about a foot of space to enter the shower. lastly, the valves were overly complicated and you would have to guess which function was in effect - the bottom nozzle, the overhaed shower, or the wall nozzle. It was a roulette game I plaved evry morning (and usually lost by getting cold water squirted on me!). Last point I want to make: This is a good hotel (note not excellent), but it tries to perport it is more upscale than it really is. Witness: they would kick everyone out of the rooftop pool area at 1800, so that they can set up for the bar. Well, some of us get back from work at 1730 and would like to use the facility for more than 30 minutes! One night there were two young girls dancing on the bar tops (employed by the hotel) after the pool area closed and the bar was open - very gauche I thought. Would I return? probably: only because I am familiar with this part of town (Kadikoy) but would entertain others if available.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice wellcome, but bugs in the bed at midnight!”
Reviews.Author: BrOi2fun
Reviews.Content: A very nice wellcome by hotel personel. A new and very good hotel at a very beautiful place of Ä°stanbul. As we entered the room, it was so hot because of the sun. But the view was beautiful. At midnight my wife found out the bugs in our bed. (More than 1 or 2) They changed our room at midnight. We were so uncomfortable after all!!! The worst thing was the receptionist when we were checking out. He asked us how our night was, and we answered with sleepy eyes as we couldn't rest after all. While we were waiting for an aÄŸpology, he asked for the extras of the room. Then he charged like 10TL for a 250ml bottle of water. That was the end of the comedy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in great part of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Ekmason
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel. Check in very efficient. Lovely room. Modern. Spacious. Fantastic bed - could have taken it home it was so comfortable. Neutrogena toiletries. Flat screen TV. Wi-fi free. Fantastic outdoor pool area with views over to Europe and Blue Mosque area. Indoor pool, sauna, steam room and jacuzzi. Breakfast great. Turkish coffee and tea on requeust. Staff really friendly. Small listimprovement suggestions: free paper. An extra lift - open up the staff one and the stair well. Huge hotel and one lift in one wing. Cleaning could be improved. Dirty coffee cup left in the room and some rubbish. Overall though cannot recommend enough. Very relaxing place to stay in a busy metropolis.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute no go! Dont expect an Hilton standard”
Reviews.Author: OkanSoysal
Reviews.Content: A very new Hotel. Good location for the Asian part of Istanbul. if you prefer : cold coffee, out of order elevators, window washers water drops during breakfast, quarrelling employees, smelly corridors, construction areas vis a vis and no management...just the place.
